strings.Value: {n}Bartholomew walks around the troll's corpse.{/n} "At least they're still vulnerable to steel and acid. Now let's look into why this creature lost its respect for fire..."

{n}Bartholomew recites an incantation and waves his hand over the troll's chest, then points at a specific spot on it. There, branded on the flesh, is a symbol of a blacksmith's hammer encircled by thorn-studded vines.{/n} "Whatever that is, that's the reason its flesh didn't burn."

{n}Harrim inspects the brand closely.{/n} "Alas, I recognize this cursed symbol. This is the hammer of {g|Torag}Torag{/g} — a god neglectful of even his most devoted followers. I don't know why his hammer is decorated with thorns, but it suits the treacherous god well."

{n}Harrim inspects the brand closely.{/n} "The same cursed symbol we saw earlier in the ruins. This is the hammer of {g|Torag}Torag{/g} — a god neglectful of even his most devoted followers. I don't know why his hammer is decorated with thorns, but it suits the treacherous god well."

{n}Ekun touches the brand carefully.{/n} "A hammer. The sign of mighty {g|Torag}Torag{/g}, god of artisans. No thorns should be there, though. Maybe some secret symbol, or maybe deliberate blasphemy. Don't know."

{n}The wizard slowly makes an incision around the brand and then peels the flesh off, excising the brand completely.{/n} "I must study this. Here's the key to my laboratory — wait for me there. I'll join you soon enough." {n}Without another word, Bartholomew whispers an incantation and vanishes.{/n}
